channel.title: [PI] How do I change ip, client- and server sided?
channel.description: Where do I change the ip in the client? clinet.java or gui.java or possibly both? And I'm not even sure about the server part :rolleyes: Please help, I would appreciate that...

openup client.java , client sided
search for

server =

then change the IP to yours
[/quote]
Lol is there a competition going on that who’ll teach him this in the simplest way ROFL ;)[/quote]

item.title: [PI] How do I change ip, client- and server sided?
item.dc:creator: @Sagi Sagi
item.description:
@Sagi wrote:

In PI, the ip is needed to be changed only client-sided. Just change ip from client side in client.java and you’re done.

Read full topic

item.title: [PI] How do I change ip, client- and server sided?
item.dc:creator: @James-RevolutionX James-RevolutionX
item.description:
@James-RevolutionX wrote:

Once you’ve changed it client sided, go into “Server” and search for 0.0.0.0 then change that to what your ip is.

Read full topic
item.source: [PI] How do I change ip, client- and server sided?

item.title: [PI] How do I change ip, client- and server sided?
item.dc:creator: @Sagi Sagi
item.description:
@Sagi wrote:

[quote=“pasta186, post:2, topic:367413”]Okai
I use delta,but im quite sure they are fairly the same
So,as for server sided,Your runserver.bat,that automatically connects to your computers address
So,basically,you dont need to do much server sided,Obviously you need to portforward
if you havent portforwarded there are many tutorials on moparscape for how to portforward

Right,so if you have portforwarded, then you need to look into gui.java. and do ‘control and f’. This opens up a search bar. Then type to search something like 127.0 or ip. It should come up with an ip,if not do that step in client.java. Now once you found that ip,you need to change it to your ip,but your ip will depend on your portforwarding method.

Sorry i couldnt of been more help,im fairly new to coding myself
Gl with this[/quote]

[pi] doesnt have “Gui.java”

[quote=“Neruzycra, post:1, topic:367413”]Where do I change the ip in the client? clinet.java or gui.java or possibly both?
And I’m not even sure about the server part :rolleyes:
Please help, I would appreciate that…[/quote]

Go to client.java and Ctrl+f and search for “serverip” or “127.0.0.1”

Read full topic
item.source: [PI] How do I change ip, client- and server sided?

item.title: [PI] How do I change ip, client- and server sided?
item.dc:creator: @pasta186 pasta186
item.description:
@pasta186 wrote:

Okai
I use delta,but im quite sure they are fairly the same
So,as for server sided,Your runserver.bat,that automatically connects to your computers address
So,basically,you dont need to do much server sided,Obviously you need to portforward
if you havent portforwarded there are many tutorials on moparscape for how to portforward

Right,so if you have portforwarded, then you need to look into gui.java. and do ‘control and f’. This opens up a search bar. Then type to search something like 127.0 or ip. It should come up with an ip,if not do that step in client.java. Now once you found that ip,you need to change it to your ip,but your ip will depend on your portforwarding method.

Sorry i couldnt of been more help,im fairly new to coding myself
Gl with this

Read full topic
